par.text: Boron is a hard, brittle metalloid. Pure crystalline boron is greyish-black. It is relatively inert chemically. In the amorphous form it is a brown powder. Boron compounds have been known since ancient times. Elemental boron was isolated in 1808 at the same time by two Frenchmen, Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac and Louis Thénard, and by the English chemist Humphry Davy.
